spanishExample: ¡Volvamos a hacer eso! Quiero tener diecisiete dólares.
englishTranslation: Let’s do that again! I want to have seventeen dollars.
vocabIncluded: a used after Volver to mean “again”

spanishExample: ¡Vuelva! Si llega tarde, será un problema.
englishTranslation: (formal) Come back! If you arrive late, it’ll be a problem.
vocabIncluded: llega: arrives, he/she/it arrives (Llegar, present, 3rd person)
será: "will be", "he/she/it will be" (Ser, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: ¡Vuelvan! Busco amigos.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Come back! I’m looking for friends.
vocabIncluded: busco: search, I search (Buscar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: ¡Vuelve! Lo mejor está por venir.
englishTranslation: Come back! The best is yet to come.

spanishExample: Ahora tiene veinte años y se vuelve loco.
englishTranslation: He is twenty now and he is going crazy.
vocabIncluded: tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)
vuelve: returns, he/she/it returns (Volver, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Busca la baja para que no la volvamos a buscar.
englishTranslation: Look for the loss so that we don’t look for it again.
vocabIncluded: a used after Volver to mean “again”
volvamos: return, we return (Volver, subjunctive, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Buscamos la media y creo que es diecinueve.
englishTranslation: We’re looking for the average and I think it’s nineteen.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
buscamos: search/seek, we search/seek (Buscar, present, 1st person plural)
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Cuando yo llegue, verás que todo estaba en orden.
englishTranslation: When I arrive, you’ll see that everything was in order.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
llegue: arrive, I arrive (Llegar, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Él llegó ayer y ahora buscan los juegos.
englishTranslation: He got here yesterday and now they are looking for the games.
vocabIncluded: buscan: search, they search(Buscar, present, 3rd person plural)
llegó: arrived, he/she/it arrived (Llegar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: El orden no importa, lo que importa es el resto.
englishTranslation: The order doesn’t matter, what matters is the rest.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
importa: matters, he/she/it matters (Importar, present, 3rd person)
orden: order (how things are arranged) (masc. noun)

spanishExample: Ella no ha llegado y nosotros llegamos hace dos horas.
englishTranslation: She hasn’t arrived and we arrived two hours ago.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
llegamos: arrived, we arrived (Llegar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Este no es el orden correcto, dieciocho va primero.
englishTranslation: This isn’t the right order, eighteen goes first.
vocabIncluded: orden: order (how things are arranged) (masc. noun)

spanishExample: Estoy buscando el largo de la mesa.
englishTranslation: I’m looking for the length of the table.

spanishExample: Llega a tiempo o no volveré a hablar contigo.
englishTranslation: Get here on time or I won’t talk to you again.
vocabIncluded: a used after Volver to mean “again”
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
volveré: will return, I will return (Volver, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: No has vuelto, pero si vuelves, te volverás loco.
englishTranslation: You haven’t gone back, but if you go back, you’ll go crazy.
vocabIncluded: has: "have", "you have" before a participle (Haber, present, 2nd person)
volverás: will return, you will return (Volver, future, 2nd person)
vuelves: return, you return (Volver, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No quiero que me vuelvan a hablar.
englishTranslation: I don’t want them to talk to me again.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a used after Volver to mean “again”
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
vuelvan: return, they return (Volver, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No quiero que vuelvas después de las tres y media.
englishTranslation: I don’t want you to come back after three thirty.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
vuelvas: return, you return (Volver, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No volverá a menos que sepa el largo del tren.
englishTranslation: He won’t come back unless he knows the length of the train.
vocabIncluded: del: "of the" before a masculine noun
volverá: will return, he/she/it will return (Volver, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No volverás a casa después de tener dieciocho.
englishTranslation: You won't go back home after you’re eighteen.
vocabIncluded: a used after Volver to mean “again”
tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)
volverás: will return, you will return (Volver, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No vuelvas a decir eso, él tiene que volver.
englishTranslation: Don’t say that again; he has to come back.
vocabIncluded: a used after Volver to mean “again”
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Quizás vuelva después de tener dieciséis años.
englishTranslation: Maybe he’ll come back after he is sixteen.
vocabIncluded: tener X años: to be X years old (idiom)
vuelva: return, he/she/it return (Volver, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si hay una baja, irá de veinte a diecinueve.
englishTranslation: If there is a drop, it’ll go from twenty to nineteen.
vocabIncluded: hay: "there is/are" indicating existence (Haber, present, impersonal)
irá: "will go", "he/she/it will go" (Ir, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si no vuelve pronto, voy a buscarlo.
englishTranslation: If he doesn’t come back soon, I’m going to look for him.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
vuelve: returns, he/she/it returns (Volver, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Siempre llegamos a tiempo, así que estamos por llegar.
englishTranslation: We always arrive on time, so we’re about to arrive.
vocabIncluded: está por llegar: about to arrive (idiom)
llegamos: arrive, we arrive (Llegar, present, 1st person plural)
the use of "por" after Estar to mean "about to"

spanishExample: Siempre volvemos cuando nos busca.
englishTranslation: We always come back when he looks for us.
vocabIncluded: busca: searches/seeks, he/she/it searches/seeks(Buscar, present, 3rd person)
volvemos: return, we return (Volver, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Solo tengo la mitad, te daré el resto cuando él llegue a casa.
englishTranslation: I only have half; I’ll give you the rest when he gets home.
vocabIncluded: daré: "will give", "I will give" (Dar, future, 1st person)
llegue: arrive, he/she/it arrive (Llegar, subjunctive, 3rd person)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")

spanishExample: Te ha buscado en la mitad de la ciudad.
englishTranslation: She has looked for you in half of the city.
vocabIncluded: ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Tenemos que hacerlo en orden, primero dieciséis, después diecisiete.
englishTranslation: We have to do it in order, first sixteen, afterwards seventeen.
vocabIncluded: using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Va a llegar a las cuatro y media porque volvió a la ciudad.
englishTranslation: She is going to arrive at four thirty because she came back to the city.
vocabIncluded: using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")
volvió: returned, he/she/it returned (Volver, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Vuelven a decir que buscas la media.
englishTranslation: They are saying again that you’re looking for the average.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
a used after Volver to mean “again”
buscas: search, you search (Buscar, present, 2nd person)
vuelven: return, they return (Volver, present, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Vuelvo hoy, pero ella no quiere que yo vuelva.
englishTranslation: I’m coming back today, but she doesn’t want me to come back.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
vuelva: return, I return (Volver, subjunctive, 1st person)
vuelvo: return, I return (Volver, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: Yo volví ayer y nosotros volveremos juntos la próxima semana.
englishTranslation: I came back yesterday and we’ll go back together next week.
vocabIncluded: volveremos: will return, we will return (Volver, future, 1st person plural)
volví: returned , I returned (Volver, preterite, 1st person)
